info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 15 at 12:46PM CDT until June 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 114 expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 115 possible. * WHERE...McMullen County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
